channel.title: Player, npc, and Object instancing
channel.description:
Hello. moparscape I would like to create an instance for players (not for player own houses) I have the instance for players but npcs and objects are still showing to all players. I have played around with both object and npc and could not get it to work.
The player object has a 'updateVisisblePlayer' method. Does the npc and object have the same methods if not would someone please redirect me to a tut or supply me with the methods thanks.

item.title: Player, npc, and Object instancing
item.dc:creator: @Mikey96 Mikey96
item.description:
@Mikey96 wrote:

As Sk8 said, just use the playerId * 4 if you’re on the “0” you can scale that to work for other height levels as well, this will give you the “individual player zone” you want.

Read full topic

item.title: Player, npc, and Object instancing
item.dc:creator: @Lordabyssal Lordabyssal
item.description:
@Lordabyssal wrote:

Well my intentions were to create an instance for guild zones, I have implemented. But I will attempt your method of handling instances to see if it is what I’m looking for.

So I tried your method and works with npcs great!. Can you lead to me a tut on adding height support for objects thanks again (I will look for a tut to)

Read full topic

item.title: Player, npc, and Object instancing
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

There’s no need to create an “instance” for the player, honestly.
The only time you really need it, is player owned houses.

Just move the player to height + 4. (4 * playerId for more instances)
So if you were on height 0, the other valid heights would be: 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, etc…
height 1: 5, 9, 13, 17, 21, 25, etc.
And so on…

Read full topic

The player object has a ‘updateVisisblePlayer’ method. Does the npc and object have the same methods if not would someone please redirect me to a tut or supply me with the methods thanks.
